member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mLevel
member.summary: 0 <= level <= 9

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mDictSize
member.summary:
(1 << 12) <= dictSize <= (1 << 27) for 32-bit version
(1 << 12) <= dictSize <= (1 << 30) for 64-bit version
default = (1 << 24)

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mReduceSize
member.summary: Estimated size of data that will be compressed. default = 0xFFFFFFFF. Encoder uses this value to reduce dictionary size

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mLC
member.summary: 0 <= lc <= 8, default = 3

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mLP
member.summary: 0 <= lp <= 4, default = 0

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mPB
member.summary: 0 <= pb <= 4, default = 2

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mAlgo
member.summary: 0 - fast, 1 - normal, default = 1

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mFB
member.summary: 5 <= fb <= 273, default = 32

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mBtMode
member.summary: 0 - hashChain Mode, 1 - binTree mode - normal, default = 1

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mNumHashBytes
member.summary: 2, 3 or 4, default = 4

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mWriteEndMark
member.summary: 0 - do not write EOPM, 1 - write EOPM, default = 0

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Master.LZMA.CLzmaEncProps.mNumThreads
member.summary: 1 or 2, default = 2

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder
member.summary: This class maintains the state of a LZMA decoder and can be used to incrementally decode input data. This class is not threadsafe and must be accessed singlethreaded or under an external lock.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.#ctor(ManagedLzma.LZMA.DecoderSettings)
member.summary: Construct a decoder with the given settings. The amount of memory required depends on the settings.
member.param: The settings for the decoder must match the settings used when the data was encoded.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.Dispose
member.summary: Release the memory used by the decoder. Depending on the allocator used it may require a garbage collector pass to actually collect it.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.AvailableInputCapacity
member.summary: The capacity of the input buffer. If this is zero you must read data from the output buffer before you can continue decoding more input data.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.AvailableOutputLength
member.summary: The number of currently available bytes in the output buffer.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.IsOutputComplete
member.summary: Returns true if the decoded output is complete. Note that some of the decoded output may still reside in the output buffer.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.ReadOutputData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to read data from the output buffer.
member.param: The target buffer into which data should be read.
The offset at which data should be written.
The maximum number of bytes to read from the output buffer.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the output buffer.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.Decoder.Decode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decode input data until either the input data has been used up, the given output limit has been reached, or the end of the decoded data has been reached.
member.param: The buffer containing input data.
The offset at which the input data begins.
The length of the input data.

A limit for the output data to decode. Already decoded but not yet read output data is counted against the limit. Can be used when the exact output length is known, or when the output buffer is limited and no readahead is wanted.
Indicates that no more input data is available.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the input.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.LZMA.AsyncDecoder
member.summary: This class maintains the state of a LZMA decoder in a threadsafe way. The actual decoding happens on a separate thread.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.AsyncDecoder.CompleteInputAsync
member.summary: Notifies the decoder that the input data is complete. The returned task notifies the caller when all output data has been read.
member.returns: A task which completes when all output data has been read.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.AsyncDecoder.WriteInputAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pass input data to the decoder. You must not modify the specified region of the buffer until the returned task completes.
member.param: The buffer containing the input data.
The offset at which the input data begins.
The length of the input data.
member.returns: A task which tells you when the input data has been completely read and the buffer can be reused.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.LZMA.AsyncDecoder.ReadOutputAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedLzma.StreamMode)
member.summary: Read output data from the decoder. You should not use the specified region of the buffer until the returned task completes.
member.param: The buffer into which output data should be written.
The offset at which output data should be written.
The maximum number of bytes which should be written.
Specifies whether to wait until the whole output buffer has been filled, or wether to return as soon as some data is available.
member.returns: A task which, when completed, tells you how much data has been read.

member.summary: Returns true if the decoded output is complete. Note that some of the decoded output may still reside in the output buffer.

member.param: The target buffer into which data should be read.
The offset at which data should be written.
The maximum number of bytes to read from the output buffer.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.None
member.summary: The file has no special attributes.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.Archive
member.summary: The file is a candidate for backup or removal.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read-only.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.System
member.summary: The file is a system file. That is, the file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributes.NotContentIndexed
member.summary: The file will not be indexed by the operating system's content indexing service.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.PosixAttributeMask
member.summary: Unofficial extension using the high bits to store posix file attributes in a 7z archive.
member.remarks:
Some third party implementations store posix file attributes in the high 16 bits. Some implementations also set bit 15 to indicate that the high bits are used, but since only some do this the bit can't be trusted and must be ignored.
Note that this is an unofficial extension making use of the fact that the official implementation was lazy in its error checking. In newer implementations the 7z UI acknowledges the extension and tries to parse it. The extension however has not become part of the 7z archive codebase, it is only handled in the UI layer.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.InvalidAttributes
member.summary: These flags do not exist and are invalid.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.ForbiddenAttributes
member.summary: These attributes cause an exception when writing them and are auto-removed when reading them.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.StrippedAttributes
member.summary: These attributes are auto-removed when reading or writing them.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.ToleratedAttributes
member.summary: These attributes are not included in the enum but are allowed to be read or written.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.DirectoryAttribute
member.summary: This attribute marks directories and is automatically managed. It is not exposed by the library except when implementing a custom metadata reader.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.ArchivedAttributesExtensions.VisibleAttributes
member.summary: Contains all publically visible attributes.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedArchiveSectionStream.Length
member.summary: Only provided for convenience, does not implement full CanSeek API contract.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedArchiveSectionStream.Position
member.summary: Only provided for convenience, does not implement full CanSeek API contract.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedArchiveSectionStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Only provided for convenience, does not implement full CanSeek API contract.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.ArchiveMetadataReader
member.summary: Allows subclasses to construct custom archive models from metadata.
member.remarks: Archives may contain a large number of files listed in their metadata stream. Reading all this file metadata into a class based in-memory model may carry significant memory overhead. Creating a subclass allows you to construct your own model of the archive metadata containing exactly the information you want and in exactly the format you want. It is also possible to entirely skip building an in-memory model of the file metadata.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.ArchiveMetadataReader.CheckFileHeader(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Checks if the stream looks like a 7z archive.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.ArchiveMetadataReader.EnablePosixFileAttributeExtension
member.summary: There exists an unofficial extension which stores posix file attributes in metadata bits which are usually zero. Enabling this extension allows to read those non-standard archives.
member.remarks: This defaults to false because it is possible that someone creates a different but incompatible extension using the same bits. It should be safe for callers to always set it to true because currently it is the only known extension.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.ArchiveHeaderMetadataReader
member.summary: Reads only the header of the archive metadata and discards file specific information.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader
member.summary: Provides an iterator-like API to unpack files from an archive section.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Metadata.ArchiveMetadata,System.Int32,ManagedLzma.PasswordStorage)
member.summary: Creates a new iteration to unpack a sequence of streams from a decoded archive section.
member.param: A readable and seekable stream for the archive.
The metadata for the archive.
The decoder section index from the metadata which should be unpacked.
An optional password to unpack the archive content.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.StreamCount
member.summary: Returns the number of streams in the section.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.CurrentStreamIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the current stream in the section.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.CurrentStreamPosition
member.summary: Returns the position in the current stream.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.CurrentStreamLength
member.summary: Returns the length of the current stream.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.CurrentStreamChecksum
member.summary: Returns the checksum of the current stream, if available.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.OpenStream
member.summary: Opens the current stream. Can only be called once per stream. Disposing the returned stream is allowed but not required.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedSectionReader.NextStream
member.summary: Disposes the current stream and moves to the next stream.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedStream.Length
member.remarks: Returning the length from a non-seekable stream is non-standard. The caller must know otherwise that we support this method.

member.name: P:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedStream.Position
member.remarks: Returning the position from a non-seekable stream is non-standard. The caller must know otherwise that we support this method.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Reader.DecodedStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeking on a non-seekable stream is non-standard. The caller must know otherwise that we support this method.

member.summary: The index of the stream. If the stream is provided by a decoder then this is an index into its output streams. If the stream is stored in the archive then this is an index into the file sections from the archive metadata.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Metadata.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Describes a compression method as defined in the 7z file format.
member.remarks: These methods are defined by the 7z file format and not by the application. You cannot add new compression methods here, nobody will understand them.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.ArchiveWriter.WriteMetadata(ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.ArchiveMetadataProvider)
member.summary: Appends a new metadata section to the end of the file.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.ArchiveWriter.WriteHeader
member.summary: Updates the file header to refer to the last written metadata section.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.ArchiveWriter.TransferSectionAsync(System.IO.Stream,ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Metadata.ArchiveMetadata,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to copy complete sections from existing archives into this archive.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.AesEncoderSettings.#ctor(ManagedLzma.PasswordStorage)
member.summary: Creates encoder settings with a random seed.
member.remarks: This overload does not dispose the encoder seed. This is no security flaw because the seed is public anyways. If you still want to ensure there are no traces in memory when you are done, use the other overload which gives you control over disposing the seed.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.EncoderInput
member.summary: Transfers external input into an encoder.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.EncoderStorage
member.summary: Transfers encoder output into external storage.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.SevenZip.Writer.EncoderConnection
member.summary: Transfers data from the output of one encoder to the input of another encoder.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.Checksum
member.summary: CRC checksum used by 7z archives.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.ConstrainedReadStream
member.remarks: This class is internal, the caller can be trusted to pass valid paramaters, so we only check them in debug mode.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.PasswordStorage
member.summary: Stores a password in a way so that memory dumps do not expose the password in plaintext. Note that the password is still recoverable with some work if you have a full memory dump. The intention is to protect against accidental exposal of the password, not protecting it from attackers.
member.remarks: Note that we store a char array and not a string so we can control its lifetime by zeroing the array contents when we are done. The intention is to avoid accidently leaving passwords in memory dumps just because the GC didn't yet get around to clean them up. To avoid issues with the array being modified after completing the task we immediately make a copy and clear the original array.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.PasswordStorage.Create(System.String)
member.summary: WARNING: This is just a convenience method. If you care about memory dumps not containing readable copies of your password you shouldn't put it in an immutable string object. Use the overload taking an array.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.PasswordStorage.Create(System.Char[])
member.summary: Returns a container storing a copy of the given password. The array passed as argument is cleared.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.PasswordAccessor.ToString
member.remarks: Intentionally not returning the password as string here because that risks leaking it in a memory dump.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.InternalFailureException
member.summary: This exception is only thrown from "impossible" situations. If it is ever observed this indicates a bug in the library.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.StreamMode
member.summary: Controls how the completion of and methods work.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.StreamMode.Complete
member.summary: Wait until the provided buffer section has been completely processed.

member.name: F:ManagedLzma.StreamMode.Partial
member.summary: Return after processing any amount of data from the provided buffer section.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.IStreamReader
member.remarks: This API is not designed for cancellation because in the context it is used there is no sane way to resume work once a sub-task has been canceled. Note that the caller can still abort the whole operation (instead of a single call) by disposing the proper controlling object.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.IStreamReader.ReadAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedLzma.StreamMode)
member.summary: Requests to read data into the provided buffer.
member.param: The buffer into which data is read. Cannot be null.
The offset at which data is written.
The amount of data to read. Must be greater than zero.
Determines the response if the buffer cannot be filled.
member.returns: A task which completes when the read completes. Returns the number of bytes written.

member.name: T:ManagedLzma.IStreamWriter
member.remarks: This API is not designed for cancellation because in the context it is used there is no sane way to resume work once a sub-task has been canceled. Note that the caller can still abort the whole operation (instead of a single call) by disposing the proper controlling object.

member.name: M:ManagedLzma.IStreamWriter.CompleteAsync
member.returns: A task which completes once all outstanding writes have been completed and any remaining data has been forwarded to the underlying receiver. In other words, once the returned task completes it is safe to dispose.
